intro: Bridelia poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar bridelia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry forest or scrubland habitats. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Bridelia poilanei is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its arid environment.
